Ali Warraich is a Pakistani professional kabaddi player, born in Kathala Chenab, Gujrat District, Punjab, Pakistan. He represents both the Pakistan national kabaddi team and competes in international leagues. Known for his quick reflexes and consistent performances, he is regarded as one of the top stoppers in the game. Tauseef Ali Warraich was also a member of Pakistan's squad for the 2020 Kabaddi World Cup (circle style).
Warraich helped establish the Gujrat Warriors for the first Super Kabaddi League in 2017, and the team won the 2018 championship by defeating the Faisalabad Sherdils 38-26.
